title: U.S. consumer Christmas spending habits 2011 to 2013
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 5 different Responses on X-axis for 3 groups 2011, 2012, and 2013. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
In Response Spend the same as last Christmas, 2013 had the highest Share of respondents 49.0 among the 3 groups and in Do not celebrate Christmas, 2011 had the lowest Share of respondents 3.0.
Among all the Responses, 2011 had the highest Share of respondents 42.0 in Response Spend the same as last Christmas and lowest value 3.0 in Response Do not celebrate Christmas.
There is a gap of 39.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for 2011 in Response Spend the same as last Christmas and Do not celebrate Christmas.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 5 different Responses on X-axis for 3 groups 2011, 2012, and 2013. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
In Response Spend the same as last Christmas, 2013 had the highest Share of respondents 49.0 among the 3 groups and in Do not celebrate Christmas, 2011 had the lowest Share of respondents 3.0.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 5 different Responses on X-axis for 3 groups 2011, 2012, and 2013. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
In Response Spend the same as last Christmas, 2013 had the highest Share of respondents 49.0 among the 3 groups and in Do not celebrate Christmas, 2011 had the lowest Share of respondents 3.0.
Among all the Responses, 2011 had the highest Share of respondents 42.0 in Response Spend the same as last Christmas and lowest value 3.0 in Response Do not celebrate Christmas.
There is a gap of 39.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for 2011 in Response Spend the same as last Christmas and Do not celebrate Christmas.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 5 different Responses for 3 groups 2011, 2012, and 2013 that are presented on the X-axis.
In Response Spend the same as last Christmas, 2013 had the highest Share of respondents 49.0 among the 3 groups and in Do not celebrate Christmas, 2011 had the lowest Share of respondents 3.0.
In Response Spend the same as last Christmas, 2011 had the highest Share of respondents among all 5 Responses and it has the lowest Share of respondents in Response Do not celebrate Christmas.
There is a gap of 39.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for 2011 in Response Spend the same as last Christmas and Do not celebrate Christmas.
Among all 3 groups, 2012 had the gap of 43.0 between the maximum and minimum Share of respondents observed in Response Spend the same as last Christmas and Do not celebrate Christmas respectively.

2013 had the maximum Share of respondents out of all 3 groups in Response Spend the same as last Christmas followed by 2013 in Spend the same as last Christmas, and the minimum Share of respondents is found for 2011 in Do not celebrate Christmas.
Averaging all 3 groups 2011, 2012, and 2013, the Response Spend the same as last Christmas is the maximum Share of respondents and Do not celebrate Christmas is the minimum Share of respondents.

data.Response: Spend the same as last Christmas
